subject: Philosophy
title: The Other and the Gaze
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Other and the Gaze.

hook.text: You're alone in a park, relaxed. Then you notice someone watching you. Everything changes.

buildup.text: Sartre said the gaze of another person turns you into an object â€” something to be judged.

discovery.text: In that moment, you lose your freedom. You become the person they see, not the person you are.

twist.text: This is why Sartre wrote 'Hell is other people.' Not because people are cruel, but because they define you.

climax.text: The struggle between your self-image and how others see you is central to existential life.

punchline.text: Hell is other people â€” because they see you.

quiz.question: What did Sartre mean by 'Hell is other people'?
options: Others define and judge us, limiting our freedom
